intro: Wissadula tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, succulent foliage that resembles a tail, hence its common name. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Wissadula tucumanensis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
